settings.text:
This framework is built on SASS, utilizing the "Scripts Organiser" and the "Advanced Themer" (AT) plugin.

To modify the settings, you can edit the SASS Variables found in the Partial called "Variables and Settings."

Regarding Colors:

The default colors of the framework are based on the colors and shades provided by AT. To establish a predefined color scheme, you should create color sets such as Primary, Secondary, Action, Accent, and Shade using AT.

If you prefer using different names for the colors, it will be necessary to make adjustments to the SASS framework by replacing the existing color names.

Plugin Requirement:

As of the time of writing, AT allows the import of a CSS file, making the CSS rules accessible within Bricks and offering the option to enqueue the file.

AT also offers a feature for importing variables using a JSON format. This entails manually creating a JSON file or parsing a CSS file to generate the JSON, which must then be updated and re-imported whenever changes are made.

Our objective is to effectively manage a SASS framework that generates a CSS file, enqueues it, and automatically updates the CSS Variables in the AT Variable Pickers, as well as the CSS Rules in the Bricks Builder, whenever modifications are made to the SASS.

This plugin provides the exact functionality needed. By simply adding the URLs for the generated CSS files, they will be parsed automatically, enabling the extraction of Variables and CSS Rules.

You can find the plugin at the following link: https://github.com/wpeasy/at-fw-import
Note: The SASS Code could just as easily be used in WPCodeBox or another SASS Compiler.

Variables:

All framework variables are prefixed by --x-

Utility Classes:

All framework classes are prefixed by .x-
Call To Action Offset. Use for offsetting Call To Action blocks
Responsive header height. Measure and set SASS Variables  in Partial.
Note: These variables reference the --x-size variables. They are separate here so you have the choice to override them without affecting sizing.
Note: These variables reference the --x-size variables. They are separate here so you have the choice to override them without affecting sizing.
Note: at the time of writing this, AT does not have color transparency. These Black and White colors with transparencies are to compensate for this.
Add to a WS Form to use styling from AT and X Framework

Put on wrappers where you want an image as a background.

position: relative;
isolation: isolate;
Put on an image to use as a background. Requires the wrapper to have .x-image-as-bg__wapper
Primary colored Button. See the SASS "Framework" for details.
Note: Button variations will only work with standard AT color names are used as above.

Makes a link clickable area expand to the nearest "relative" parent.

Note: The parent must have "position: relative"
Note: this is styling for WS Form forms.
Note: Most accessibility styles are applied in the background. This is just a few that may be used on elements manually.
Hide element visually without affecting screen readers.

Use for BricksForge SCRUB translate properties to 0.
Add translations to an element at the ID level, the add this class. It will animate the translations to 0 in tehviewport.
